definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage
to persuade using all possible arguments (idiom); to act good cop and bad cop in turn
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
to pay respects during a festival
at the Chinese New Year or other festivities
to not get along well/to be at odds
erhua variant of 小兩口|小两口[xiao3 liang3 kou3]
congratulate an elderly person on his birthday/offer birthday felicitations
